step1.sentence: The program was designed to have a lasting impact on the communities it served.

step2.story: She had given the keynote to an audience of two thousand people. Over the following year, she received forty-three emails from people who had been in the room. Each one described a specific change they had made because of something she had said. Forty-three out of two thousand was a small percentage and a lasting impact.

step3.story: The urban greening initiative had planted twelve thousand trees across the city over five years. An evaluation ten years later measured what the team had expected — reduced heat island temperatures, improved air quality, higher property values in affected neighborhoods. What they had not expected to find, and what moved them most, was survey data showing that neighborhoods with the most trees also reported the highest community cohesion scores. The trees had created meeting points, shaded benches, and shared maintenance responsibilities that had built social fabric alongside the canopy. The lasting impact had exceeded the original design.
